We were in town for a surprise birthday party and impromptu wedding. The house is 3 blocks from a train line that is active around 11-12pm and occasionally 1x/day. I enjoyed it, but bring earplugs if you are concerned. Other than that, the neighborhood is fairly quiet. The house currently doesn't have WiFi but Aberdeen has enough hot spots (coffee shop, restaurants - even McDonald's) to assist. The house has a washer/dryer which is great for extended stays; it's nice to do laundry before re-packing. :)

I was concerned about working with someone that wasn't in Aberdeen (Roger lives in MN) but Roger was always on point with my odd ball requests and I was very comfortable communicating with him (he now knows my crazy family!). Roger was able to accommodate a 1-day early arrival and a 2 day extension for a family member that was having hotel issues. While the house doesn't have WiFi, texting and phoning worked well to contact Roger.

The TV remote wasn't working properly but we barely had time to be in the home to watch anyway. We only had one "house" hiccup when the plumbing line needed work because of tree roots interrupting service. but again, Roger was on point and had an action plan within an hour. He even refunded us one day for the inconvenience!

I invited family to tour the house and I envision that others will be contacting Roger for future trips "home".

Thanks Roger, for being so gracious and patient. I look forward to contacting you again. :)

review_text: We arrived during a rainstorm, so the roads were difficult to navigate. So, be wary of traveling conditions on the way there. Due to the dirt roads being slippery, nearby ponds and ditches off the road, it can be a bit stressful to drive through, while your car slides from side to side. With that being said, the scenic route definitely made up for the inclement weather. The location is perfect for those seeking privacy and seclusion. You’re in a fairly secluded area with a great view of a large pond, livestock, open plains and cornfields in the background. Be wary of tons of bugs come nightfall. They are attracted to the lights and can sneak in, if the door is left open. Don’t expect to have phone service as described, it comes and goes. I would suggest you bring dvd's, books, or anything that can be viewed offline. If you have a hotspot, then this probably wouldn't affect you. The water was a bit tricky to get right at first, given there were instructions. We finally got the shower water running somewhat warm for a quick shower, after fidgeting with the faucet and shower water. It was then that we finally understood the instructions. Basically, you just need to keep the sink faucet running on hot at the same time, while the shower is running. There is a nice bed, TV, DVD player, Apple TV device (no WiFi), towels, shampoo, cooking pots/pans, utensils, two burner stove, and a mini fridge. This place has all of the basic necessities you need. If you can reserve a stay there during clement weather, don’t hesitate to. You'll have a perfect time there, while enjoying the amazing the view.
